item.title: Webclient fitting to screen isnt working
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

using this result:

<script type="text/javascript"> var width; var height; if (window.innerWidth) { width = window.innerWidth; height = window.innerHeight; } else if (document.all) { width = document.body.clientWidth; height = document.body.clientHeight; } function getWidth() { return width; } function getHeight() { return height; } </script>on firefox, i got the results of 1024x675 on a 1024x768 monitor.
this being because the content pane is 93px lower due to firefox’s window header (address bar, menu, etc.) with my current settings.

got some pretty effective work with this:

[code=HTML]

game body { color: white; background: black; } #nav { position: absolute; top: 7px; } a { padding: 0 10px 0 0; } #game { position: relative; top: 25px; }
homeplayforumvotedonate
[/code] so try that and see how it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient fitting to screen isnt working
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

Vain_:

you want the to extend the entire contents of the window, horizontally and vertically (minus the page’s navigation bar) regardless of the applet’s size?

I think he’s saying the header is taking up space reserved for the client. So the client moves down to make room for the header, but the actual area of where the client should be doesn’t move down.

Why don’t you post a picture jal?

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient fitting to screen isnt working
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Fit a re-sizable webclient on a page. I put a fixed width and height on it earlier but it doesnt look as good as it does when it takes up the whole screen.

I’ll attempt to explain it again because the previous explanation isn’t the best.

The client normally takes up the whole screen because the js tells it to. When I put in the header of the website the client will take up whatever room is left. That’s fine, but the problem is that it’s not showing the whole client now. The whole chat box and everything to the right is missing because of this.

Read full topic

item.source: Webclient fitting to screen isnt working

item.title: Webclient fitting to screen isnt working
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Bare with me, im having trouble explaining this thoroughly.

The webclient was fitting to the screen correctly but after I added the header the client has moved down a tad(as expected) but isnt showing the whole client. Think of it as a set width and set height box. The client takes up the whole box. You add something in the box that takes up 1/3 of the box but now only 2/3 of the client is showing instead of resizing.

lol I hope that makes sense…

Here is what im working with:

<script type="text/javascript">
	var width;
	var height;
	if (window.innerWidth) {
		width = window.innerWidth;
		height = window.innerHeight;
	} else if (document.all) {
		width = document.body.clientWidth;
		height = document.body.clientHeight;
	}
	function getWidth() {
		return width;
	}
	function getHeight() {
		return height;
	}

AAAAND

<script>
		document.write("<applet code=\"Loader.class\" width=\"" + getWidth() + "\" height=\"" + getHeight() + "\" archive=\"client.jar\"><param name=\"width\" value=\"" + getWidth() + "\"><param name=\"height\" value=\"" + getHeight() + "\"></applet>");
	</script>

Read full topic
